'''Cuind''' was a term used by some [[Avari]] to describe themselves. It is unknown if the name "Cuind" was applied o a particular group of Avari specifically or to all Avari as a whole.

==Etymology==
It is an [[Avarin]] word meaning "the People". It derives from [[Primitive Quendian]] ''[[kwende|kwendī]]''.<ref name="Author">{{WJ|Author}}, Note 9, p. 410</ref>
==See also==
*[[Kindi]]
*[[Kinn-lai]]
*[[Hwenti]]
*[[Windan]]
*[[Penni]]
==Portrayal in adaptations==

'''1982-97: ''[[Middle-earth Role Playing]]'':'''
: ''Cuind'', an articulation of "Quendi" (the most ancient name of the Elves), is also the name of a tribe of Avari Elves of the jungles of the [[Mûmakan]] in the Utter South of Middle-earth.<ref>{{ICE|2026}}, p. 18</ref>
